channel.title: Got my VPS running
channel.description:
I got my vps running but now when I load the client I get this:
[IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/fp2p7b.jpg[/img]
How do I fix this? (willing to TeamView)
Test Client [url=http://www.rswebclients.com/play/JavaQuest]http://www.rswebclients.com/play/JavaQuest[/url] - in case you guys wanna test it.

item.title: Got my VPS running
item.dc:creator: @m4x_pwng3 m4x pwng3
item.description:
@m4x_pwng3 wrote:

Jmood:

The client says unexpected server response, which means the client was given a response code that isn’t correct. Make sure the client and server are using the same revision e.g (317, 377, 474, 503, 508, 614, 700, ect, ect).

They’re both Project Insanity clients.

Read full topic

item.title: Got my VPS running
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

The client says unexpected server response, which means the client was given a response code that isn’t correct. Make sure the client and server are using the same revision e.g (317, 377, 474, 503, 508, 614, 700, ect, ect).

Read full topic

item.title: Got my VPS running
item.dc:creator: @m4x_pwng3 m4x pwng3
item.description:
@m4x_pwng3 wrote:

Jmood:

I haven’t used Linux in a while, but the most likely problem is you didn’t open the port. If you bought a managed vps you should have access to the firewall with the web UI. But other then that it could also be the iptables.

I did a status check and it says that the server is up and running and ready to play yet i still keep getting this error.

Also did a netstat and this is what it says

Read full topic

item.title: Got my VPS running
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I haven’t used Linux in a while, but the most likely problem is you didn’t open the port. If you bought a managed vps you should have access to the firewall with the web UI. But other then that it could also be the iptables.

Read full topic

item.title: Got my VPS running
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“m4x pwng3, post:7, topic:515878”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=634131.msg4282576#msg4282576 date=1365902530]

Wait… You have a linux command line VPS. how… How does one manage that? They usually have some sort of gui.

it’s got a gui built in but I prefer CL… but that’s a different story

So stop being a moron and just run it with the GUI?
At least you could get the preferences done first.
[/quote]

Look dude, I simply asked for help with my problem. If you’re gonna insult me and not gonna help, don’t reply. Who cares if I’m using the CL or GUI. I just want to get it fixed.[/quote]
Set up the preference s through the GUI and make sure it’s running correctly through GUI first. Then run command line.

Read full topic
